list_definition.definition: (often with ever) from a certain time onwards

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I have been at home (ever) since I returned from Italy.
Since he agreed to come, he has become ill.
Since you are going, I will go too.

list_definition.definition: (usually with ever) from that time onwards

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We fought and I have avoided him ever since.

list_definition.mean_english: từ một thời điểm trong quá khứ đến nay
list_definition.definition: from the time of (something in the past) until the present time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She has been very unhappy ever since her quarrel with her boyfriend.

list_definition.definition: at a time between (something in the past) and the present time

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I’ve changed my address since last year.

list_definition.definition: from the time of (the invention, discovery etc of)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the greatest invention since the wheel.

list_ex_of_english: Indeed, they cannot do so, since a debt cannot be paid twice, and their own reparation - their repentance and apology - sufficiently pays it.
They do care about the methodology since it affects the efficiency of their software development process and their revenue.
Since resurrection bodies are incorruptible, they are not carbonbased and hence not identical to organisms, human biological bodies.
His condition had worsened since his last visit 1 week earlier.
Since the robot is only expected to have to negotiate small grades, it only incorporates suspension systems at the two lateral wheels.
Basically, farmers and businessmen are opposed to green taxes because they increase production costs and are burdensome since they create uncertainty about future tax levels.
She has been continuously hospitalized since she was in her teens.
Since a machine at some initial time is at rest, this constant must be zero.
